titleStmt.title: William Campbell et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5505

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlett Govenor of Kentucky Your petitioners would respectfully represent that on the 27 day of August 1864 Elba Ulin a respectable citizen of Boyd County was tried before Richard Scott a Justice of the peace of said county and was fined twenty six dollars and fifty cts for assault and battery the proof in the case was of a conflicting character and we do not think that he should be in the fine we therefore respectfully ask your excellency to remitt said fine

Wm Campbell
J. D. Kincaid
W. A. Foster
J Wellman
John H Ford
J. D. Jones Co atty
B Burk
Geo W. Andrews
John Blander
Martin Keyser
